intro: Hieracium griseolans, commonly known as the gray-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, typically found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. The plant features upright stems with basal leaves that are gray-green in color, giving it its common name. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster, typical of the daisy family. Hieracium griseolans is an herbaceous perennial that can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
